posts.post_content: Have a [Research](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Research) in hand, an ornithopter, 1 cmc sorceries or instants, and this in hand. [Selective Memory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selective Memory) yourself to remove everything you can. Research oh let's say a [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) or fun things like[Inferno](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inferno). Play Possibility Storm and ornithopter into Blightsteel. Pulled this off with [Melek, Izzet Paragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Melek, Izzet Paragon) on the field. I still lost, but my friend could not figure out what I was doing!

We all could be wrong....this is a complex spell....

So i just checked it out on MTGO...it does stack......

posts.post_content:
Strange question:  
What would happen if, using this, you play a spell and, in response to having to exile it, you consume it with [Nivmagus Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nivmagus Elemental)?  
  
Would you still even get the Possibility Storm effect of getting a new randomized spell? Furthermore, if you exile it with Nivmagus, does it end up exiled with him or PS (putting it back in your deck).  
  
If any of this is possible, some serious nastiness could be possible with foddering instants and sorceries.

posts.post_content:
My favorite thing about this card is how it was designed for Izzet in terms of flavor and playability, but it works so magnificently in a Gruul deck.  
Imagine, a 2-headed giant team consisting of a mana ramp deck with this sort of card, to get it out in the first couple turns, and a creature deck with half one-mana creatures and half 6+ mana creatures.  
Each turn, the creature deck plays a one mana creature, but then it turns into a game-ending 7 mana creature. The mana ramp deck just stalls.  
Rinse and repeat.
posts.html:
